author: Special Correspondent
text:
Two people, the owner of a mobile phone shop and an engineering student, were killed in separate accidents on Thursday night.

In the first incident, a 50-year-old man driving a scooter was killed on the spot when an unidentified vehicle knocked him down on Lalbagh Road.

Case registered

Passers-by rushed him to St John's Hospital where the doctors declared him and brought dead. The Wilson garden traffic police have taken up a case and are investigating.

In another incident, a 23-year-old was killed when a car knocked him down in Madiwala on Thursday night around 11.45 p.m.

The deceased, Arun Kumar, a resident of Jaibhima Nagar and final year engineering student, was returning home with friends after having dinner at a hotel. While he was crossing the road on 1st stage Madiwala, a car ran over him after knocking him down.

Passers-by nabbed the driver identified as Manikantha who was trying to flee and handed him over to the Madiwala traffic police.

title: Shop owner, student killed in accidents
